description: a(n) = least k such that sum of first k primes is n times a prime.
links: T. D. Noe and R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000, first 1000 terms by T. D. Noe.
example: For example a(3)=10 because the partial sum of first 10 primes is 3*43=129
mathematica: a[n_] := Catch[For[p=0; sp=0; k=1, True, k++, p = NextPrime[p]; sp = sp+p; If[PrimeQ[sp/n], Throw[k]]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 59}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 13 2012 *)
prog: (Haskell)a045985 n = head [k | (k, x) <- zip [1..] a007504_list,                      let (y, r) = divMod x n, r == 0, a010051' y == 1]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 05 2015
author: _Felice Russo_
